Braille.AllDotsBrailleCursor.title: All Dots Braille Cursor
Braille.AllDotsBrailleCursor.description: Whether to display the braille cursor as all dots raised instead of showing it using only dots seven and eight.

schema.title: Attribute Rotation Delay
schema.description: When in Attribute Mode and characters have multiple attributes, determines how long each attribute should be shown for. This value is in Milliseconds.

schema.title: Auto Pan Mode
schema.description: The "Auto Pan" algorithm to use.
enumLabels: move display minimally to include whole word containing cursor
move display to show whole word at cursor nearest the middle of the display area
Smart Autopan, autopan using the best algorithm for the current situation

Braille.BrailleAutoRouteToCursor.title: Braille Auto Route To Cursor
Braille.BrailleAutoRouteToCursor.description: Whether to automatically route the Braille display to the active cursor whenever the active cursor moves or a key on the keyboard is pressed.

Braille.BrailleCursorBlinkRate.title: Braille Cursor Blink Rate
Braille.BrailleCursorBlinkRate.description: Speed, in milliseconds, at which the cursor on the braille display should blink.

Braille.BrailleKeyInterruptSpeech.title: Braille Key Interrupt Speech
Braille.BrailleKeyInterruptSpeech.description: Whether to Interrupt speech if a keystroke in the Braille display is pressed.

schema.title: Enable Flash Messages
schema.description: Whether or not to show Flash Messages on a braille display.

schema.title: Braille Mode
schema.description: Use this option to control the format of the information sent to the braille display. When Line mode is selected, JAWS sends the line of text at the current cursor position to the braille display. When Structured mode is selected, JAWS sends information to the display that is relevant to the current cursor position. The information sent includes things such as control type, dialog name, or number of items in a list. When Speech Output mode is selected, JAWS sends the same text to the display that it sends to the synthesizer. The default setting for this option is Structured.

Braille.BrailleMoveActiveCursor.title: Braille Move Active Cursor
Braille.BrailleMoveActiveCursor.description: Whether to move the active cursor when the Braille cursor moves.

schema.title: Enable Braille Sleep Mode
schema.description: Whether to turn off the braille driver, typically used to disable braille for a specific application.

schema.title: Braille Verbosity
schema.description: Sets braille verbosity for Flash messages.

Braille.ContractedBrailleInput.title: Contracted Braille Input
Braille.ContractedBrailleInput.description: Enable contracted braille to be entered on the braille display's keyboard.

schema.title: Braille Dots
schema.description: The number of braille dots (six or eight) to use.

Braille.FilterControlCharacters.title: Filter Control Characters
Braille.FilterControlCharacters.description: Whether or not to filter certain control characters (currently newlines, linefeeds and tabs)

Braille.GeneralizeBullets.title: Generalize Bullets
Braille.GeneralizeBullets.description: Whether to treat all bullets the same.

Braille.Grade2SuppressCapitalSigns.title: Grade2 Suppress Capital Signs
Braille.Grade2SuppressCapitalSigns.description: When Grade 2 is on, whether or not to show capital indicators

schema.title: Enable Flash Message Prefixes
schema.description: If a display has no Status Cells, whether or not to prepend the Message Prefix to the Flash Message

Braille.MessageStatusText.title: Message Status Text
Braille.MessageStatusText.description: The text to show in the status area of the display when a Flash message is being shown if the display has no status cells, the text will be prepended to the Flash message.

schema.title: Flash Message Timeout
schema.description: When a Flash message is sent to the display via a script, how long in milliseconds should it be shown if not specified by the script.

schema.title: Reverse Panning Buttons
schema.description: Whether or not panning buttons are reversed.

schema.title: Reverse Order of Structured Data
schema.description: Whether to reverse the order of the structured data to show the focused control's info first, followed by its grouping information, and then the dialog box information. By default, items are read in the opposite order.

Braille.UseHowManyStatusCells.title: Use How Many Status Cells
Braille.UseHowManyStatusCells.description: How many cells to use for status information if the display defines none of its own.

Braille.UseScreenModelForBrailleInRichEd.title: Use Screen Model for Braille in Rich Edits
Braille.UseScreenModelForBrailleInRichEd.description: Whether to use the screen model when providing field prompts and text in Braille with rich edits.

schema.title: Enable Word Wrap
schema.description: Whether or not to allow words to be split in order to maximize the use of the braille display. Ignored if panning is set to fixed increment

schema.title: FSCast Notifications
schema.description: Whether to have JAWS display a dialog when new podcasts from Freedom Scientific are available.

schema.title: Abbreviations
schema.description: Whether to expand abbreviations.  If this is enabled, abbreviations with a title attribute will have their title read instead of the on screen text.

schema.title: Speak Access Keys Within Web Page
schema.description: Whether to announce HTML element access keys when reading a web page.

schema.title: Acronyms
schema.description: If this is enabled, acronyms with a title attribute will have their title read instead of the on screen text.

HTML.BlockQuoteIndication.title: Block Quote Indication
HTML.BlockQuoteIndication.description: Whether to indicate HTML block quotations.

HTML.EmbeddedActiveXSupport.title: Embedded ActiveX Support
HTML.EmbeddedActiveXSupport.description: Whether or not to support embedded ActiveX controls such as Macromedia Flash Movies.  If enabled, only objects defined in JActiveX.ini are affected by this setting.

schema.title: Expand Abbreviations
schema.description: Whether or not to expand abbreviations (using the abbr tag).

schema.title: Expand Acronyms
schema.description: Whether or not to expand acronyms (using the acronym tag).

schema.title: Filter Consecutive Duplicate Links
schema.description: Whether to skip (not announce) consecutive duplicate links.

schema.title: Form Field Prompt Options
schema.description: Which attributes to prefer when describing form fields.
enumLabels: use both label and title if different
use both label and alt if different

schema.title: Forms Mode Auto Off
schema.description: Whether or not Forms Mode should be automatically turned off when the current page is updated.

HTML.GraphicalLinkLastResort.title: Graphical Link Last Resort
HTML.GraphicalLinkLastResort.description: What to announce when a graphical link contains no title or alt text for its enclosing image and the enclosing anchor has no title.
HTML.GraphicalLinkLastResort.enumLabels: Read the image's src, Read the image's enclosing anchor's href.

HTML.IdentifyLinkType.title: Identify Link Type
HTML.IdentifyLinkType.description: Whether to distinguish the various types of links e.g. "FTP link", "mailto link" versus simply announcing "link" for all types of links.

HTML.IdentifySamePageLinks.title: Identify Same Page Links
HTML.IdentifySamePageLinks.description: Whether to identify links that point to other places on the current page by saying "same page link".

schema.title: Ignore Inline Frames
schema.description: Whether to ignore inline frames, such as those used for advertising.

schema.title: Include Graphics
schema.description: Whether/when to include graphics in web pages.
enumLabels: include graphics that have labels, i.e. alt=attributes

schema.title: Indicate ColSpan for Braille
schema.description: Whether to announce column spans when reading table data in web pages.

HTML.IndicateElementAttributes.title: Indicate Element Attributes
HTML.IndicateElementAttributes.description: Whether to announce any HTML attributes defined in the "HTML Attributes Behavior" map of the current scheme.

HTML.ListIndication.title: List Indication
HTML.ListIndication.description: Whether to announce lists with the item count and nesting level.

HTML.MaxLineLength.title: Max Line Length
HTML.MaxLineLength.description: The maximum number of characters which can appear on a line of a paragraph.

HTML.PageRefreshFilter.title: Page Refresh Filter
HTML.PageRefreshFilter.description: How often, in milliseconds, to allow all refreshes.  Set to 0 to allow all refreshes without any delay.

schema.title: Read Web Pages Automatically When Loaded
schema.description: Whether to automatically read web pages when they're first loaded.

HTML.ScreenFollowsVCursor.title: Screen Follows Virtual Cursor
HTML.ScreenFollowsVCursor.description: Whether the screen should automatically scroll to display the line on which the Virtual Cursor is positioned.

HTML.SkipPastRepeatedText.title: Skip Past Repeated Text
HTML.SkipPastRepeatedText.description: Whether to position the Virtual Cursor on the first line which is different than the previous page whenever a new page is displayed.

schema.title: Smart Navigation
schema.description: Whether to enable "smart navigation" when reading web pages.

HTML.TableDetection.title: Table Detection
HTML.TableDetection.description: Whether to announce all tables, or only data tables.
HTML.TableDetection.enumLabels: Indicate all tables, Only indicate data tables

HTML.TblMaxCellTextLength.title: Table Maximum Cell Text Length
HTML.TblMaxCellTextLength.description: A cell is considered a valid data cell if it contains upto this number of characters

HTML.TblMinCellTextLength.title: Table Minimum Cell Text Length
HTML.TblMinCellTextLength.description: A cell is considered a valid data cell if it contains at least this number of characters

HTML.TblMinTextColumns.title: Table Minimum Text Columns
HTML.TblMinTextColumns.description: This option specifies the minimum number of columns which must contain text in order for the table to be considered a data table.

HTML.TblMinTextRows.title: Table Minimum Text Rows
HTML.TblMinTextRows.description: This option specifies the minimum number of rows which must contain text in order for the table to be considered a data table.

HTML.TblMinValidDataRows.title: Table Minimum Valid Data Rows
HTML.TblMinValidDataRows.description: Next options used for configuring how data tables are detected This option specifies the minimum number of valid data rows that a table must contain in order for it to be considered a data table.

HTML.TblValidRowThreshold.title: Table Valid Row Threshold
HTML.TblValidRowThreshold.description: This option specifies the minimum number of cells that a row must contain in order for it to be considered a valid data row.

schema.title: Text Block Length
schema.description: The number of consecutive characters that must appear in a web page for JAWS to treat this as a block of text.

HTML.UseLegacyIESupport.title: Use Legacy IE Support
HTML.UseLegacyIESupport.description: Whether or not to use legacy IE support instead of the default FS Dom Server support.

HTML.WrapNavigation.title: Wrap Navigation
HTML.WrapNavigation.description: Whether or not to allow navigation keystrokes such as tab and shift tab to wrap to the top or bottom of the document.

schema.title: AllCapsIndicator
schema.description: The text to read before text that appears in all capital letters.

schema.title: Allow Mouse Echo
schema.description: Whether to echo mouse movement when otherwise muted.

schema.title: Allow Reading Commands
schema.description: Whether to allow speech on demand when otherwise muted.

schema.title: Allow Typing Echo
schema.description: Whether to echo typed keys when otherwise muted.

schema.title: Cap Indicator
schema.description: The text to read before a capital letter.

schema.title: Caret Blink Rate
schema.description: How fast the caret blinks, in milliseconds.

schema.title: Caret Detect
schema.description: How many cursor blinks are used to locate the caret.

schema.title: Caret Detect Timeout
schema.description: The number of milliseconds before JAWS for Windows will give up looking for the caret

OSM.CaretTimeOut.title: Caret Time Out
OSM.CaretTimeOut.description: The time in milliseconds to wait before redrawing the caret.

schema.title: Case
schema.description: Whether to indicate the case of spoken text with a change of inflection.

schema.title: Custom Page Summary
schema.description: What to do when a virtual document loads for which a custom page summary has been defined.
enumLabels: do nothing ("Say All" will be started as normal)
The summary will be spoken and focus left on the page at the place defined by the page
the summary will be presented in the virtual viewer for the user to immediately read

schema.title: Detect Keyboard Languages
schema.description: Whether to detect the language used by the keyboard.

schema.title: Dictionary
schema.description: Whether words, phrases, abbreviations, or symbols should be processed through a global or application specific dictionary to determine proper pronunciation. This is enabled by default.

schema.title: Filter
schema.description: Determines how repeated characters are handled.

schema.title: Generalize Dialect
schema.description: Whether to switch languages when encountering content with the same underlying base language.

schema.title: Indentation
schema.description: Whether or not to announce indentation.

schema.title: Indicate Attributes on Dialogs and Menus
schema.description: Whether to announce attributes in dialogs and menus if the scheme allows for it.

schema.title: Indicate Caps
schema.description: When to indicate the presence of capital letters.
enumLabels: indicate caps when spelling or when navigating by character
also indicate caps when reading by words
also indicate caps when reading by lines

schema.title: Indicate Newlines and Paragraphs
schema.description: Whether/how to indicate the presence of new lines and paragraphs.
enumLabels: indicate when typing and the editor or wordprocessor wraps to a new line
indicate when arrowing left/right or using left/right with modifiers
indicate when typing and also when arrowing. the method of indication is controlled by the Speech and Sounds scheme in use
indicate when reading text containing newline characters bitwise or the values together to indicate in multiple contexts eg a value of

schema.title: List Item
schema.description: Use this list to determine how JAWS describes list box items. Select "Say None" to silence reading of list box descriptions. When you select "Say Selected", JAWS only tells you when list box items are selected. When you select the "Say Not Selected" item, JAWS only tells you when list box items are not selected. This is the default setting. If you select "Say Both", JAWS tells you when list box items are selected, and when they are not selected.

schema.title: Initial State of NumLock Key
schema.description: The initial state of the NumLock key.

schema.title: Insert Key Mode
schema.description: The operating mode of the insert key.

schema.title: JAWS Insert Key
schema.description: Whether/which insert keys can be used as a JAWS Insert.

schema.title: JAWS Punctuation Enabled
schema.description: Which punctuation marks to speak.

schema.title: Key Repeat
schema.description: Whether or not to allow repeated keys.  Repeated keys are allowed by default.

schema.title: Language Detection
schema.description: Whether to enable automatic Language detection.

schema.title: Left Shift Skip Back
schema.description: How the shift keys should behave in "Say All" mode.
enumLabels: during SayAll, right shift will skip back and left shift will skip forward
during SayAll, left shift will skip back and right shift will skip forward

schema.title: Less Speech Options
schema.description: How to behave when in "less speech mode".

schema.title: Line Pauses
schema.description: Whether to pause at end of a line.

schema.title: Lower Audio Volume of Programs while JAWS Speaks
schema.description: Whether to lower the volume of programs other than JAWS when speaking.

schema.title: Migration Wizard Displayed
schema.description: Whether or not to display the migration wizard on startup.

schema.title: Mixed Case
schema.description: Whether to announce words with embedded capital letters (such as "MixedCase") as separate words.

schema.title: Speak Control Type and State of Item
schema.description: Whether to speak the type of control and state of item when mousing over a control.

schema.title: Speak Description of Item
schema.description: Whether to speak the description of an item on mouseover.

schema.title: Mouse Echo Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to stop speaking when the mouse is moved.

schema.title: Mouse Echo Delay
schema.description: How long to delay announcing content under the mouse, in milliseconds.  Defaults to 0 (no delay).

schema.title: Mouse Echo Unit
schema.description: The unit of text to announce when the mouse pauses over text in a control.  Defaults to reading the whole line.

schema.title: Enable Mouse Echo
schema.description: Whether or not to enable the mouse echo, i.e. reading content under the mouse pointer.

schema.title: Numbers
schema.description: How to announce numbers.

schema.title: Allow On Screen Keyboards
schema.description: Whether to allow on screen keyboards.

schema.title: Process Tooltip Event
schema.description: Whether or not to process tooltip events.

schema.title: Progress Bar Update Interval
schema.description: How often to announce progress bar updates, in milliseconds.  Set to 0 to disable update announcements.

schema.title: Quick Key Navigation Mode
schema.description: Navigation Quick Keys let you move through Web pages with easy to remember commands, such as T for table, F for form field, N for non link text, and V for visited link. These commands are only available when the Virtual Cursor is active. Use these radio buttons to set Navigation Quick Keys off, on, or on only during Say All reading. The default is on.

schema.title: Reading Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to interrupt speech when a key that is bound to a macro is pressed.

schema.title: Repetitions
schema.description: Whether or not to indicate repeated characters.

schema.title: "Say All" Ignores Shift Keys
schema.description: Allows sticky keys to be used, i.e.: ignores shift keys during SayAll. User can use left/right arrow to do same functions.

schema.title: "Say All" Announces Capitals
schema.description: In "Say All" mode, announce an initial capital letter or capitalized word.

schema.title: "Say All" Mode
schema.description: Sets the amount of text which "Say All" sends to the synthesizer as a single unit.

schema.title: Say Blank Line Count
schema.description: In "Say All" mode, whether to announce the number of blank lines.

schema.title: Say Cursor Shape Change
schema.description: Whether to announce a change in the shape of the cursor.

schema.title: Say Dollars
schema.description: Whether to announce currency symbols.

schema.title: Say Numeric Dates
schema.description: How to announce numeric dates.  With no translation, dates are read as numbers.  With some translation, dd-mm-yy values are read as text.  With extended translation, both dd-mm-yy and dd-mm values are read as text.

schema.title: Say Selected First
schema.description: Whether to announce the selected text first.

schema.title: Say State First
schema.description: Whether to announce the window state before title/text.

schema.title: Say Window Type First
schema.description: Whether to announce the type of window before announcing the window title/text.

schema.title: Scheme
schema.description: Whether or not to intercept CreateDIBSection Note that this value is only read once per JAWS session at startup thus changing this value while JAWS is running has no effect.

schema.title: Screen Echo
schema.description: Use the radio buttons in this group to determine how much text is read when information on the screen changes. This includes highlighted text, all text as it appears, or no speech echo as text appears or changes on screen. The default setting is Echo Highlighted Text. Changing the Screen Echo setting may affect the reading of menus and other items. For this reason, it is recommended that you only make Screen Echo changes in application-specific settings files.

schema.title: Simultaneous Synth and Wave
schema.description: Whether to enable smoother playing of WAV files when using the DEC Talk Access 32 software synthesizer. This option is only available in Default.jcf. Changes to this setting take effect the next time you start JAWS.  Disabled by default.

schema.title: Single Digit Threshold
schema.description: The number of digits a number must contain before it is read as single digits (like a phone number).  Defaults to five.

schema.title: Skim Reading Indication
schema.description: Whether or not to indicate (via a beep) when skimming over text units for which the regular expression returns FALSE.

schema.title: Skip ILM
schema.description: Whether to show the licensing manager on startup when running in 40-minute evaluation mode.
enumLabels: display the license manager on startup
do not display the license manager on startup

schema.title: Smart Word Reading
schema.description: Whether or not to enable "smart reading" when using the "Say Word" command.

schema.title: Speak ANSI Chars
schema.description: Whether or not to announce ANSI characters.

schema.title: Speak Character Value As Sequence of Multibyte Values
schema.description: Whether to read unicode characters as a series of multi-byte values.

schema.title: Speak Character Value In Hex
schema.description: Whether to announce the hex value of a character when numpad 5 is pressed three times quickly.

schema.title: Numbers Containing Dashes as Digits
schema.description: Whether to read numbers that contain dashes (such as phone numbers) as a series of digits.

schema.title: Enable Speech History
schema.description: Whether to read through the 50-item speech history when "insert+spacebar" and then "h" are pressed.

schema.title: Speech Mode
schema.description: The "speech mode" to use, either "full" or "less".

schema.title: Spell Alphanumeric Data
schema.description: How to read alphanumeric data.

schema.title: Spell Phonetic
schema.description: How to announce word spellings.

schema.title: Synthesizer
schema.description: The synthesizer to use/ Available synthesizers are listed in JfW.INI

schema.title: Synthesizer Reset Frequency
schema.description: How often to reset communication with the synthesizer, in milliseconds.

schema.title: Tether Jaws to PC
schema.description: Whether or not to tether the JAWS cursor to the PC cursor.  If this is set to 'on', whenever the Pc cursor moves, the Jaws cursor will follow it. If this is set to 'off', the JAWS cursor is indifferent to PC cursor movements (this is the default).

schema.title: Text Analyzer
schema.description: The type of alert to use when announcing formatting errors.

schema.title: Touch Alternative Character Panel Popup Notification
schema.description: How to announce the appearance of a panel of alternate keys in the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Touch Keyboard Notification
schema.description: Whether/how to notify when the touch keyboard appears/disappears.

schema.title: Touch Typing Echo
schema.description: Whether/how to echo text entered using the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Touch Typing Mode
schema.description: Which keyboard mode to use for the touch keyboard.

schema.title: Typing echo
schema.description: How to announce typed words and/or characters.

schema.title: Typing Interrupt
schema.description: Whether to stop speaking when the user types.

schema.title: Use Extended Keys
schema.description: Whether to distinguish between extended and number pad keys.
enumLabels: Treat Extended and Numpad keys the same
Differentiate between Extended and Numpad keys

schema.title: Use Virtual Info in Forms Mode
schema.description: Whether to use information from the virtual HTML area for prompts in Forms mode. Warning: this will not always result in accurate information, particularly on pages where there are errors in the HTML coding which result in forms mode and virtual mode being out of synchronization.

schema.title: Verbosity
schema.description: How verbose announcements should be.

schema.title: Virtual MSAA Refresh
schema.description: How often (in milliseconds) should an embedded ActiveX control cause the Virtual HTML area to be updated when receiving rapid ValueChange events from MSAA.  Set to -1 to disable refreshes.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Color
schema.description: The colour to use when highlighting items selected using the touch cursor.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Spacing
schema.description: The amount of spacing between the highlight box and the highlighted item.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Style
schema.description: The style of highlighting to use.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Thickness
schema.description: How thick to make the "box" and "underline" highlighting styles.

schema.title: Visual Tracking Transparency
schema.description: How transparent to make the visual highlighting of selected items.

schema.title: Highlight Touch Cursor
schema.description: Whether or not to highlight selected items when using the touch cursor or touch gestures.

schema.title: Use Virtual PC Cursor
schema.description: Whether to use the virtual PC cursor when reading HTML documents.

schema.title: Use Virtual Ribbon Menu
schema.description: Whether to turn on the virtual ribbon menu.

OSM.GraphicsMode.title: Graphics Mode
OSM.GraphicsMode.description: How to handle graphic CRC values.
enumLabels: Store graphic CRC values when the graphics are being drawn to the screen.
Compute them from the screen image at the time they are requested to be spoken.

OSM.IgnoreSetSysModal.title: Ignore Set Sys Modal
OSM.IgnoreSetSysModal.description: Whether to disallow Windows calling the SetSysModalWindow function. In most cases this is desirable, because System Modal Windows cannot be spoken.

OSM.IncludeLines.title: Include Lines
OSM.IncludeLines.description: Whether to include line segments in the Off Screen Model. This is required for Excel and other programs which draw a focus rectangle.

OSM.MouseClickFudgeX.title: Mouse Click Fudge X
OSM.MouseClickFudgeX.description: number of pixels to the right of the current JAWS cursor at which a mouse click should be simulated

OSM.MouseClickFudgeY.title: Mouse Click Fudge Y
OSM.MouseClickFudgeY.description: number of pixels below the current JAWS cursor at which a mouse click should be simulated

OSM.PixelsPerBlankLine.title: Pixels Per Blank Line
OSM.PixelsPerBlankLine.description: how many pixels (high) per blank line

schema.title: Pixels Per Space
schema.description: When simulating spaces in blank portions of a line, the number of pixels used to represent each space.

schema.title: Pixels Per Tab
schema.description: The number of pixels per tab, used to estimate the number of tab spaces contained within the blank portion of a line.

OSM.SpeakSysModalMessageBox.title: Speak Sys Modal Message Box
OSM.SpeakSysModalMessageBox.description: Whether to announce System Modal Message Boxes.

schema.title: Table Presentation Information
schema.description: Which tables to read as tables (data tables, or all tables).

OSM.TextOutDelay.title: Text Out Delay
OSM.TextOutDelay.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before announcing newly written text. Setting this to a non-zero value may cause terminal programs to respond in a less choppy fashion.

OSM.TrackCommandBars.title: Track Command Bars
OSM.TrackCommandBars.description: Whether to track the menu bar in Office applications.

schema.title: Track Focus Rectangle
schema.description: Set to one causes MAGic to track the focus rectangle in standard controls that utilize focus rectangles.

OSM.TrimBrailleGraphicLabels.title: Trim Braille Graphic Labels
OSM.TrimBrailleGraphicLabels.description: Whether to trim the size of a braille graphic. Useful to preserve the virtical positioning of braille text.

schema.title: Underline Proximity
schema.description: How far away in pixels can an underline be before being considered an actual underline.

schema.title: Flick Velocity
schema.description: The minimum finger velocity to treat as a "flick".

schema.title: Explore Delay
schema.description: The delay between touching a touch screen and displaying the explore menu, in milliseconds.

schema.title: Double Tap Speed
schema.description: The threshold for treating two taps as a double-tap, expressed in milliseconds between taps.

schema.title: Tap Radius
schema.description: The size of the finger contact spot on the touch screen.

schema.title: Active Voice Profile Name
schema.description: The active voice profile.

schema.title: Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for all types of announcements.

schema.title: Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for all announcements (scale varies by voice).

schema.title: Synth Language
schema.description: The language to use for all announcements.

schema.title: Global Volume
schema.description: The volume for all announcements.

schema.title: JAWS Cursor Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for announcements related to the JAWS cursor.

schema.title: JAWS Cursor Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for the JAWS cursor.

schema.title: JAWS Cursor Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for announcements related to the JAWS cursor (scale varies by voice).

schema.title: JAWS Cursor Language
schema.description: The language to use for announcements related to the JAWS cursor.

schema.title: JAWS Cursor Volume
schema.description: The volume for announcements related to the JAWS cursor.

schema.title: Keyboard Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for announcements related to the keyboard.

schema.title: Keyboard Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for announcements related to the keyboard.

schema.title: Keyboard Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for announcements related to the keyboard (scale varies by voice).

schema.title: Keyboard Language
schema.description: The language to use for announcements related to the keyboard.

schema.title: Keyboard Volume
schema.description: The volume for announcements related to the keyboard.

schema.title: Menu and Dialog Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for announcements related to menus and dialogs.

schema.title: Menu and Dialog Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for menus and dialogs.

schema.title: Menu and Dialog Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for announcements related to menus and dialogs (scale varies by voice).

schema.title: Menu and Dialog Language
schema.description: The language to use for announcements related to menus and dialogs.

schema.title: Menu and Dialog Volume
schema.description: The volume for announcements related to menus and dialogs.

schema.title: Message Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for message announcements.

schema.title: Message Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for messages.

schema.title: Message Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for message announcements.

schema.title: Message Language
schema.description: The language to use for message announcements.

schema.title: Message Volume
schema.description: The volume for message announcements.

schema.title: PC Cursor Pitch
schema.description: The pitch to use for announcements related to the PC cursor.

schema.title: PC Cursor Punctuation
schema.description: How much punctuation to announce for the PC cursor.

schema.title: PC Cursor Rate
schema.description: Speech rate for announcements related to the PC cursor (scale varies by voice).

schema.title: PC Cursor Language
schema.description: The language to use for announcements related to the PC cursor.

schema.title: PC Cursor Volume
schema.description: The volume for announcements related to the PC cursor.
